title: Second suspect sought in shooting death of 7-year-old girl
content:
A second suspect is wanted in the shooting death of a 7-year-old girl earlier this month, police said.
Jonathan Campos, 22, is wanted on three warrants, one for capital murder and two for aggravated assault, according to the San Antonio Police Department.
Iris Rodriguez was fatally shot in the head June 1 as she and her family walked past a group of men who had been arguing in the 5500 block of San Fernando Street, according to the San Antonio Police Department.
They were yards away from home when someone in the group told the family to get the girl inside the house.
Iris, who was shot in the head, was taken to University Hospital and remained on life support until she died the next day. Her mother was shot in the arm, but has since recovered from her injury.
Frank Gomez, 28, was arrested about two days after the incident and charged with capital murder. Investigators said he was recognized by one of the witnesses at the scene.
Anyone with information on Campos is asked to call SAPD’s homicide unit at (210) 207-7635 or Crime Stoppers at 224-STOP (7867).
